description: From Portuguese arrátel, from Andalusian Arabic الرَطْل‎ (“rottol”), from Arabic الرَطْل‎ (ar-raṭl), from Aramaic רִיטְלָא‎ / ܪܺܝܛܠܳܐ‎ (rīṭlā), variant of לִיטְרָא‎ / ܠܺܝܛܪܳܐ‎ (līṭrā), from Ancient Greek λίτρα (lítra, “libra, Roman pound”). Doublet of libra, livre, libbra, liter, and rottol.

entries.meaning: (historical) A traditional Portuguese unit of mass, usually equivalent to 459 g.
